FAB-2429 - Additional Manager on Leave request Intake

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Keep consistency in message, important words must have captital first letter. So "Additional mangaer" should be "Additional Mangaer" and "Absence case" should be "Absence Case"

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Do we need this? Its only used in one place. also the message has a spelling error: "Failed remove Part Case Role", should be "Failed remove Party Case Role"

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: PartyFactory.getPartyManager().removePartyCaseRole throws LockingException. Hence thought of catching it and throwing GenericUncheckedException with message. Corrected the message

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Added common method getPartyEntityEmployeeFromAbsenceCase which is being called from both places

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This shoudl also be used for getEmployerFromAbsenceCase(). the problem is that getPartyEntityEmployeeFromAbsenceCase is defined to return PersonEntity, which is wrong. Also you are casting to PersonEntity in the getPartyEntityEmployeeFromAbsenceCase. You should return PartyEntity and should be casting to PartyEntity to it can be re-used for both person and organisation.

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: changed getPartyEntityEmployeeFromAbsenceCase() to return PartyEntity. Calling this from getAdditionalManagerFromAbsenceCase, getEmployeeFromAbsenceCase and casting to appropriate types in thes individual methods getEmployerFromAbsenceCase is no longer using same logic to fetch PartyEntity. So not valid now this now.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: 2nd part of Javadoc makes no sense. "This method removes the PartyCaseRole from the Absence Case" is fine.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Same comment for createPartyCaseRole javadoc

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: What if there is more than one PCR with the specified role name? Are we expecting to only remove the first one? Seems odd to me...

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: I did not consider that there can be more that one Partyes with specified role. I considered the scneario of only one party role on case. But to use this service more generically, i guess we chould loop through and remove all party case roles with specified role. Modified code to loop through the list and remove PartyCase role

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: You tests dont test for > 1 PCR removal

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Modified Test to check > 1 PCR removal. Test now verifies is the removePartyCaseRole method is called as many times as the list size

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Use Arrays.asList(roleName) rather than creating a new list and then calling list.add();

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Modified code

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Can you spot the bug here?!
roleName is completely unused and instead you are removing the OCCaseForAbsence.ADDITIONAL_MANAGER_CASE_ROLE_NAME role. This method is totally wrong for all other usages!!

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Fixed. Ya didnt focus on the fact that it is supposed to be a generic method

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Modified code to use Google Guava

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: I am removing all of them now in the loop. So isEmpty() check not needed. But keeping null check

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I'm not convinced about .get(0), what about the rest of the PCRs?

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay
comments.comment: Correct. Modifed the code to remove all the PCR's as this is supposed to be generic method. Pass in the case and role name, it will remove all PartyCaseRole associated to case with specified role name.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Any particular reason why this getter is before we declare all the fields?
To keep consistency we should first declare the fields at the beginning of the class and only then declare the accessor methods.

comments.comment:
Can we remove the constant TAB_TITLE_TEST from LeaveRequestConstants?
Its not being used at the moment.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Can we put these constants in one place? It seems we have these defined in 2 different table model classes. - SelectedLeavePlansForLeaveRequestListviewTableModel - SelectedLeavePlansForAbsenceCaseListviewTableModel
Keeping them in constants class would make it reusable from a wider places. In this case, make sure the variable names are given as per the icon not where it is used.
